result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis F. Anderson

defendant.name: Anderson, Curtis F.
defendant.address: W2135 County Road M, Pine River, WI 54965

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:16 am cases called-15CM24 & 15CM221. Defendant Curtis F. Anderson in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in 15CM221 in consideration of sentencing on 15CM24. Court dismisses and reads-in 15CM221. Victim statement. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1 & 2-SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. COUNTS 3, 4, & 5-Impose 120 days WCJ on each count, consecutive to each other, STAYED and placed on probation for a period of 3 years.  COUNTS 6, 8, & 9: Impose 7 months WCJ, on each count, consecutive to each other, STAYED and placed on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS ON COUNT 1 ONLY-34 days WCJ with 34 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS ON ALL COUNTS: No Contact with victim. Court states the only time the parties are to be in the same room would be to address the pending divorce. No Contact with Lisa Lee, Sandra Sage, and/or Travis Anderson-unless any of the parties (Lisa, Sandra, or Travis) make a request in writing to the probation agent to have contact with the defendant. DAAP and follow through. Defendant is not to possess any firearms-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety. Court will allow the defendant to request review of the weapon and absolute sobriety conditions after a period of 18 months. Court orders a psychological evaluation and follow through. Court will allow for petition of early termination after 2 years. Costs to be paid out of bond, paid in full. Appeal Rights Given.
from Judge Dutcher to Atty Tom Johnson Re: Motion to Amend Bond
from Atty Tom Johnson to Judge Dutcher Re: Motion to Amend Bond

2:59 pm case called. Defendant Curtis F. Anderson in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Search Warrant Return, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant, Warrant Return for Ford F150 extended cab four wheel drive pickup truck bearing WI plate 257083F (Curtis Anderson)

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is not to be in possession of any firearm or any other device that is being possessed with the intent of harming or threatening to harm another.

12:15 pm case called. Defendant Curtis F. Anderson in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated-defendant has received a copy. Right to counsel addressed-defendant wishes to retain counsel. Statement by Court regarding counsel. Defendant is referred to SPD. Bond statement by DA Blader. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Court directs State to provide clothing for defendant for matter scheduled on Thursday.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:00 am.
